content.raw:
Yes almost all of the code is from the gzbridge, 

The motivation to have it in a separate was that we want to make the ```sdfviewer``` headless and reusable, so, e.g. I'm a user who want to try my model on the ```sdfviewer``` , since we don't parse materials right now in the ```sdfviewer``` -to make it headless-, I thought a separate package for users to parse their materials would be a suitable choice. 

This might not be the best idea, but it did the job and was fine for me.

About the file that is not being parsed, I believe if the package couldn't parse it ```gzweb``` is not supposed to be able to too, which file was it?
content.html:
Yes almost all of the code is from the gzbridge,

The motivation to have it in a separate was that we want to make the sdfviewer headless and reusable, so, e.g. I'm a user who want to try my model on the sdfviewer , since we don't parse materials right now in the sdfviewer -to make it headless-, I thought a separate package for users to parse their materials would be a suitable choice.

This might not be the best idea, but it did the job and was fine for me.

About the file that is not being parsed, I believe if the package couldn't parse it gzweb is not supposed to be able to too, which file was it?
